meanings.definition: To turn over quickly or lightly
meanings.sent1: I will flip the pancake in the pan.
meanings.sent2: She likes to flip through the pages of her favorite book.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to flip the toy mouse but ended up chasing it instead.
meanings.sent4: His decision to flip the switch turned on the lights in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast can flip effortlessly on the balance beam.

meanings.definition: To toss or throw with a quick motion
meanings.sent1: He will flip the coin to decide who goes first.
meanings.sent2: The chef will flip the pizza dough in the air.
meanings.sent3: She tried to flip the ball to her friend but missed and hit the wall.
meanings.sent4: The magician will flip the cards in a mesmerizing way.
meanings.sent5: The athlete can flip the frisbee with precision.

meanings.sent1: The weather can flip from sunny to rainy in minutes.
meanings.sent2: Her mood can flip from happy to sad very quickly.
meanings.sent3: The plan to go to the park might flip to a movie night instead.
meanings.sent4: The market can flip directions in a matter of seconds.
meanings.sent5: The decision to flip the coin determined the winner.

meanings.definition: A quick, sharp movement or sound
meanings.sent1: The light switch made a loud flip when turned on.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's flip was so quick that it amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The sudden flip of the bird startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The flip of the coin decided the fate of the game.
meanings.sent5: The flip of the paper caught everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The circus performer executed a perfect flip on the trampoline.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's flip in the air was graceful and precise.
meanings.sent3: The dog attempted a flip but ended up rolling on the grass.
meanings.sent4: The dolphin's flip out of the water was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The acrobat's flip left the audience in awe.
